config.settings_hint: Parents will be asked to confirm their details so you can see who last checked the details and when they checked them.

config.settings_optin_description: Photos & medical details can require additional consent depending on your lawful processing mechanism.  You can store/collect consents through OSM.  Please select ONE photographic consent option that is the closest match to your requirements (as giving parents to choose any of the options would make it impractical to take photos).  All changes to these fields will be stored in the member's history.

fields.name: Mike Johnson
fields.pL: Can your  Beaver float in a buoyancy aid for 5 mins and be able to kick and swim, ie they are happy to swim in a pool wearing armbands and not panic when in the water.  They do not need to tread water for 5 mins without floatation help

eventJson.name: Sarah Wilson
eventJson.publicnotes:
We will be taking the Beavers out on the river as our traditional end of term event across both Beaver colonies.

All Beavers will be in buoyancy aids and in canoes or on a SUP with suitably experienced and qualified leaders.

If anyone is not confident in the water with flotation devices then we will put them in a life jacket and ensure 1:1 adult supervision.

Please can you mark availability on this event, and answer the question about whether your Beaver would be happy floating in water in a buoyancy aid without panicking. A good indication is if they are happy swimming in a pool with armbands and kicking and moving around. They do not need to be able to tread water or swim without any flotation device

We wont be able to take anyone out on the water without an answer to this question.

Also please ensure that suitable footwear is worn, which is water shoes or old trainers that you dont mind them getting wet (as they will do). We have water shoes for purchase at the HQ. They will not be allowed on the water wearing sandals, sliders, crocs or similar.

Whilst you are in OSM, please take the opportunity to ensure all the details are up to date and all questions answered for medicines etc.

Any questions, dont hesitate to ask on email or WhatsApp.

Wednesday and Thursday Beaver Teams

items.title: Indoor Campfire

All badge requirments covered over the weekend

items.title: Kubb
items.description:
Kubb, or Viking's Chess, is a Nordic lawn game. The game was invented in 1911 by Alton Kuse, though some claim that the game originated in ancient Scandinavia over 1,000 years ago.
Kubb, also known as "The King's Game" is a fantastic traditional game that has been played in Sweden for at least a century - it is a sort of cross between Skittles and Tennis.

It is a strategy-based game that involves skill and precision and is usually played on a rectangular pitch, lawn, or sandy ground. The objective of the game is to knock over wooden blocks, known as "kubbs," by throwing wooden batons to ultimately topple the central king kubb placed in the middle of the pitch.

Kubb is a wonderfully unique game of skill that is ideal for garden parties or just fun on a field. Kubb games can be played one against one or in teams of up to 6 players on each side. For alternative court sizes and advice on variants for younger players, please see our Kubb rules.

items.title: Park life portraits
items.description: Visit to local park to gather natural materials to make natural portraits.  See 'Park Life Portrait' activity on Scout website.

Nautical Skills Staged Activity Badge - Stage 1.
 Activity aimed at Part 2. Correctly identify the different equipment used for the activity you chose.

items.title: RLSS water safety
items.description:
RLSS Water Safety & Drowning Prevention information.
 Show a clip and discuss the reasons for swimming in open water, lakes, rivers, etc.
What they could do to help is use the emergency number and call for help
Show a PowerPoint slide about water temperature and currents.

items.title: Book Character Charades
items.description: In this activity, Beavers will act out book characters without speaking, while others guess who they are, encouraging discussions about literature.

items.title: Coloured Hoops
items.description:
Have four -six different coloured hoops 
Get the leader to look away and give beavers or cubs 10 seconds to choose a colour.
Leader shouts a random colour and anyone in that colour is out.
If only using 4 hoops when down to just 4 beavers or cubs left, they must have a different hoop so you have a chance of a winner.

items.title: Paint Azulejo tiles
items.description:
First suggested by Moot 2025 United Kingdom Contingent
 Unleash your creativity while exploring the vibrant art of Portugal’s iconic tiles.

1518_0.name: Jane Smith
1518_0.description:
Complete two personal challenges, for example:
 * Look after a new Beaver for half a term
* Talk about a topic you are interested in with an adult you don’t know very well
 * Bring your scarf to Beavers every week for a term
* Remember to brush your teeth twice a day for two weeks
* Show good behaviour at Beavers for 3 weeks in a row
* Try something new that you are a bit nervous about
* Go to a District fun day and talk to some other Beavers you don’t know
* Try all of the food on Beaver sleepover
* Remember to feed your pet every morning for a week

95_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of hikes before the record was put in OSM. 

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it includes hikes from previous sections.
 
Then add a new column for each hike, and enter the number of hikes completed (usually 1).

94_0.name: Mike Johnson
94_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of nights away before OSM. 

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it includes camps from previous sections.

Add a new column for each camp, and enter the number of nights completed.

1635_0.name: Mike Johnson
1635_0.description:
Stage 123 Example Streetart.  Stage 2 if BCU Paddle Discover Award.  Stage 3 if BCU Paddle Explore Award.  Stage 4 if the scout has 2 BCU Performance Awards (see The Scouts website for further details).

Scouts must complete each stage before moving to the next stage, and stage 3 must be completed in a different boat to stage 2.

1636_0.name: Kate Taylor
1636_0.description: Each stage can automatically be earned if the scout has the equivalent RYA Youth Sailing Scheme Staged award.  Each stage can only be completed when the previous stage has been completed.   Stage 123 Example Streetage 2.

5965_1.name: Jane Smith
5965_1.description: Before starting the next stage, the requirements for the previous stage must have been met.

23361_0.name: Kate Taylor
23361_0.description: Each level can be earned by having equivalent swimming awards from national swimming providers.  See The Scouts' website for more details.

104_0.name: Jane Smith
104_0.description:
In the 'Initial Pre-OSM' column, enter the number of sessions the scout had before the scout's record was put in OSM.  If the scout has been transferred to you then this field will already be set - do not change it.

Do not expect the Total column to be the addition of everything you see on screen as it will also include sessions from previous sections that you cannot see here.

Then add a new column for each event, and enter the number of sessions completed on that event (typically 1).

You can not delete columns, as that needs to exist behind the scenes for the calculations in other sections.
